title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Firelands Regional Medical Center (Sandusky, OH) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: General questions on experience, what jobs you liked, why do you want to work in this field? They tell you about the position, pay, benefits. You meet with recruiter and administrative head person.
Interview Questions: What past employment have you had

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Firelands Regional Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Firelands Regional Medical Center, will blacklist applicants. They won't even give nurses an interview that did clinicals there, no matter how many applications you fill out. They will not allow you to submit applications for the same unit within 1 year time. So, if they don't five you an interview for that unit, you might as well as forget about it and move on with your life
Interview Questions: I and many nurses I know didn't even get an interview.

title: Behavioral Health Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Firelands Regional Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Have to go through firelands.com, get call for interview, they check references before it goes farther which is through email. If offered have to go through physical health tests at corporate health.
Interview Questions: What is something that you feel you want to improve on with your role?

title: Dietary Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Firelands Regional Medical Center (Sandusky, OH) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: They called me a few days after I applied, however, I did apply a day after the job was posted. They asked for my availability and we set a date for an interview. I took the offer right away! My recruiter made me very comfortable and was nice, I was excited during my interview.

title: Family Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Firelands Regional Medical Center (Sandusky, OH) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: One interview. Spoke one-on-one with the VP of operations. Reviewed my resume and routine interview questions. Toured facility with medical director and met with staff. I had a chance to ask questions after everything was finished.
Interview Questions: What is your goal? What are your strengths and weaknesses? Why do you want to work for us?

title: Housekeeping Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Firelands Regional Medical Center (Sandusky, OH) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Met with HR lady - had a hard time finding where to go but when I did find it, the peoele were nice and helpful. The interview had a serious tone (which it should) but I didn't end up getting a call back so that was a bummer to me. I will keep applying though.
Interview Questions: She asked me a lot about my work history - I don't have much experience so that made sense to me.

title: Unit Coordinator/Orderly Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Firelands Regional Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, met with nursing recruiter about 3 weeks later. Same day went and met nursing supervisor/director on floor i was interviewing for. Recruiter asked basic questions that you have in every interview. Supervisor did not ask 1 question, which I thought was strange. Got a call the next day offering me the job.
Interview Questions: If you were part of a salad, which part would you be.

title: Unit Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Firelands Regional Medical Center (Sandusky, OH) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: Took about a month, very long process.

title: Environmental Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Firelands Regional Medical Center in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: Took a really long time to get a call then had to do a phone interview and then submit to a reference check plus many many other hoops. Overall not a bad process but way to long for cleaning rooms.

title: Network Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Firelands Regional Medical Center (Sandusky, OH) in Dec 2010
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straight forward interview with a focus on technical ability. Their main priority is the technical Q&A, but their judgement of how well you're fit into the team from a personality standpoint is very important also. The interviews are generally with a manager, a team lead and 2-3 other analysts.
Interview Questions: Nothing stands out, but their technical Q&A is probably a little more advanced than what you're used too.
